DataElement.preferredName: Patient Biopsy Assessment Intervention or Procedure Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the determination of biopsies to establish a diagnosis and the patient's consent to interventional strategies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Biopsy Assessment Intervention or Procedure Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Permission to do something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Biopsy Assessment Intervention or Procedure Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Permission to do something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are patient's tumors determin
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are patient's tumors determined to be easily accessible for biopsy and patient is willing to have serial biopsies (with a third biopsy upon evidence of disease progression)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is biopsiable disease present and patient is willing to undergo pre-treatment and on-treatment biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC cohort) is patient able to undergo a fresh tumor biopsy for the purpose of screening for this clinical trial (including able and willing to give valid written consent) or to provide an available archival tumor sample taken less than 3 months prior to study enrollment (and not obtained prior to progression on a PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor) if a fresh tumor biopsy is not feasible with an acceptable clinical risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient who is willing to provide tumor biopsies for research have tumors deemed relatively safely accessible for biopsies with low likelihood of complication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is disease amenable to core biopsy and patient is willing to undergo the required research biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's tumors determined to be easily accessible for biopsy and patient is willing to have serial biopsies (with a third biopsy upon evidence of disease progression)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient consents to provide biopsies for research, are tumors deemed easily accessible for biopsies with low likelihood of complication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor accessible for biopsy and is agreeable to baseline tumor biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor amenable to image guided or direct vision biopsy and be willing and able to undergo a tumor biopsy for molecular profiling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC/SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC cohort), is patient able to undergo a fresh tumor biopsy for the purpose of screening for this clinical trial (including able and willing to give valid written consent) or to provide an available archival tumor sample taken less than 3 months prior to study enrollment (and not obtained prior to progression on a PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor) if a fresh tumor biopsy is not feasible with an acceptable clinical risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are patients tumors determined to be easily accessible for biopsy and patient is willing to have serial biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does agree to a pre-treatment biopsy or is willing to provide an archival FFPE specimen for LC/MS analysis of 2-HG to be sent to the ETCTN Biorepository and Pharmacology Core at Karmanos Cancer Institute?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the Phase 2 portion of study, is patient willing to undergo fresh biopsies at baseline (as opposed to using archival tissue), in the event they are randomized to the gamma H2AX pNBS1 multiplex IFA assay?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have lesions that can be safely biopsied and is willing to have a pre-treatment biopsy and a blood collection at baseline for submission to the ETCTN Biorepository?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's tumor safely accessible for biopsy and patient is willing to undergo biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Research Only biopsies, i.e., biopsies from medical procedures that are not scheduled for medical necessity, does the patient have tumor amenable to image guided or direct vision biopsy, and is the patient willing and able to undergo a tumor biopsy for molecular profiling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo pre-treatment biopsy if disease site is amenable to biopsy and has low risk for the biopsy procedure, after informed consent and within 14 days prior to start of protocol therapy for sending to the ETCTN Biorepository?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumors that are amenable to biopsies and patient is willing to undergo biopsies at two time points (pre- and on-treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the expansion arm, is patient willing to undergo paired biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in expansion phase, is patient willing to undergo 2 core needle biopsy procedures for research purposes if there is a lesion or lesions amenable to repeat biopsy?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
